dk.thibaut.serial

Class SerialPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.thibaut.serial.SerialPort

  • public abstract class SerialPort
extends Object
    This class represents a physical serial port.

    You will never instantiate it directly, instead you must use the getAvailablePorts() static function to retrieve a list of currently available ports name and get an instance of SerialPort by calling the open(String) static method.

    You can configure the serial connection using setConfig(SerialConfig) and setTimeout(int). After calling open(String), you can call getChannel() to get the associated SerialChannel, and use it to send and receive data.

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailablePorts

        public static List<String> getAvailablePorts()
        Get the list of available serial ports on the system.

        Returned port names are platform-specific, for example COMXX on Windows, and /dev/ttyXX on Linux.

        Returns:
        A list of ports names.

      • open

        public static SerialPort open(String portName)
                       throws IOException
        Opens a serial port.

        Internally, this class instantiate a subclass of SerialPort according to the running platform, and opens the underlying port.

        The port will remain opened until the underlying SerialChannel is closed, or the close() method is called. A closed port cannot be opened again, you must get a new instance using this function.

        Parameters:
        portName - The platform-specific name of the port.
        Returns:
        An opened SerialPort.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurs while opening the port.
        RuntimeException - If the platform is not supported.

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream()
                           throws IOException
        Get an InputStream that can be used to read data from the port.
        Returns:
        An InputStream object, wrapping the native SerialChannel
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.
        IOException

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream()
                             throws IOException
        Get an OutputStream that can be used to write data to the port.
        Returns:
        An OutputStream object, wrapping the native SerialChannel
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.
        IOException

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(BaudRate b,
                      Parity p,
                      StopBits s,
                      DataBits d)
               throws IOException
        A shortcut to setConfig(SerialConfig).
        Parameters:
        b - Baudrate setting
        p - Parity setting
        s - Stopbits setting
        d - DataBits setting
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs when calling the native function.
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.

      • setConfig

        public abstract void setConfig(SerialConfig config)
                        throws IOException
        Sets the configuration to use for this port.
        Parameters:
        config - The configuration to apply.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs when calling the native function.
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.
        See Also:
        setConfig(BaudRate, Parity, StopBits, DataBits)

      • getConfig

        public abstract SerialConfig getConfig()
                                throws IOException
        Returns the current configuration of this port.
        Returns:
        A SerialConfig object containing current settings.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs when calling the native function.

      • setTimeout

        public abstract void setTimeout(int timeout)
                         throws IOException
        Sets the read timeout for this port.

        This function supports two special values:

        • TIMEOUT_INFINITE: Read calls won't return until some bytes are available.
        • TIMEOUT_IMMEDIATE: Read calls will return immediately, even if no bytes are available.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout value, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs when calling the native function.
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.

      • getTimeout

        public abstract int getTimeout()
                        throws IOException
        Get the current read timeout.
        Returns:
        The timeout (in milliseconds) or one of the special values TIMEOUT_INFINITE or TIMEOUT_IMMEDIATE
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs when calling the native function.
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.

      • getChannel

        public abstract SerialChannel getChannel()
                                  throws IOException
        Get the associated SerialChannel that can used to read and write data.

        If you close this channel, the port will also be considered closed.

        Returns:
        A unique instance of SerialChannel
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException - If the serial port is closed.
        IOException

      • isOpen

        public abstract boolean isOpen()
        Get the current opening status of the port.

        The port is always opened when you create it. It will be closed only if you call close() or close the underlying SerialChannel or streams.

        Returns:
        True is the port is opened, false if it has been close.

      • close

        public abstract void close()
                    throws IOException
        Close the port.

        After closing the port, you can't re-open it, and you should not use it.

        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs when calling the native function.
